trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Configuring B2B Messaging Using BizTalk Services Portal and Bridges
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Configuring B2B Messaging Using BizTalk Services Portal and Bridges

trans-unit.source: <token>af_integration_full</token> provides two key integration possibilities – enterprise application integration (EAI) and business-to-business (B2B) messaging using EDI.
trans-unit.target: <token>af_integration_full</token> provides two key integration possibilities – enterprise application integration (EAI) and business-to-business (B2B) messaging using EDI.

trans-unit.source: Using EAI, you can create <token>af_integration</token> <token>bridge</token>s that are deployed on <token>azure_1</token>.
trans-unit.target: Using EAI, you can create <token>af_integration</token> <token>bridge</token>s that are deployed on <token>azure_1</token>.

trans-unit.source: Using B2B, you can create trading partners and agreements to process EDI messages on the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Using B2B, you can create trading partners and agreements to process EDI messages on the cloud.

trans-unit.source: You can then route the EDI messages to the already deployed <token>af_integration</token> <token>bridge</token>s for additional processing.
trans-unit.target: You can then route the EDI messages to the already deployed <token>af_integration</token> <token>bridge</token>s for additional processing.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial provides step by step instructions to create, deploy, and test an end-to-end <token>af_integration</token> scenario.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial provides step by step instructions to create, deploy, and test an end-to-end <token>af_integration</token> scenario.

trans-unit.source: Business Scenario
trans-unit.target: Business Scenario

trans-unit.source: Contoso and Northwind are two business partners.
trans-unit.target: Contoso and Northwind are two business partners.

trans-unit.source: Contoso (the retailer) sends sales order messages to Northwind (the supplier).
trans-unit.target: Contoso (the retailer) sends sales order messages to Northwind (the supplier).

trans-unit.source: Northwind maintains all the sales order data in table called SalesOrder, which is housed in a SQL Server database within Northwind’s premises.
trans-unit.target: Northwind maintains all the sales order data in table called SalesOrder, which is housed in a SQL Server database within Northwind’s premises.

trans-unit.source: Contoso can send either XML messages or EDI messages to Northwind.
trans-unit.target: Contoso can send either XML messages or EDI messages to Northwind.

trans-unit.source: So Northwind has to implement a solution to enable the following:
trans-unit.target: So Northwind has to implement a solution to enable the following:

trans-unit.source: Contoso can send either an X12 message or an XML message for sales order.
trans-unit.target: Contoso can send either an X12 message or an XML message for sales order.

trans-unit.source: Contoso must send messages that conform to the schema for the sales order message expected by Northwind.
trans-unit.target: Contoso must send messages that conform to the schema for the sales order message expected by Northwind.

trans-unit.source: Contoso can also send XML messages to directly insert sales order data in the SalesOrder table in Northwind’s SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: Contoso can also send XML messages to directly insert sales order data in the SalesOrder table in Northwind’s SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: To enable this scenario, Northwind does the following:
trans-unit.target: To enable this scenario, Northwind does the following:

trans-unit.source: For Contoso to send XML messages, Northwind configures an <token>request_response</token> on <token>af_integration</token> to enable message validation and transformation.
trans-unit.target: For Contoso to send XML messages, Northwind configures an <token>request_response</token> on <token>af_integration</token> to enable message validation and transformation.

trans-unit.source: This bridge takes an input XML message, validates it against the sales order schema required by Northwind, and transforms the message to that schema.
trans-unit.target: This bridge takes an input XML message, validates it against the sales order schema required by Northwind, and transforms the message to that schema.

trans-unit.source: Northwind also uses <token>lobconnect</token> to enable connectivity to the on-premises SQL Server database from the <token>request_response</token> deployed on the <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Northwind also uses <token>lobconnect</token> to enable connectivity to the on-premises SQL Server database from the <token>request_response</token> deployed on the <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: For Contoso to send EDI X12 messages, Northwind uses the <token>tpm_portal</token> to configure and deploy an agreement in which Contoso can send an EDI/X12 message to Northwind.
trans-unit.target: For Contoso to send EDI X12 messages, Northwind uses the <token>tpm_portal</token> to configure and deploy an agreement in which Contoso can send an EDI/X12 message to Northwind.

trans-unit.source: The following illustration summarizes the scenario:
trans-unit.target: The following illustration summarizes the scenario:

trans-unit.source: Integration Capabilities Demonstrated in this Tutorial
trans-unit.target: Integration Capabilities Demonstrated in this Tutorial

trans-unit.source: The scenario used for this tutorial helps us showcase the following integration capabilities of <token>af_integration</token>:
trans-unit.target: The scenario used for this tutorial helps us showcase the following integration capabilities of <token>af_integration</token>:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Message transportation</embeddedLabel>: The retailer and supplier can be present in different platforms and conform to different transport protocols and message formats.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Message transportation</embeddedLabel>: The retailer and supplier can be present in different platforms and conform to different transport protocols and message formats.

trans-unit.source: The <token>af_integration</token> implementation helps bridge these differences by understanding the different protocols and message formats.
trans-unit.target: The <token>af_integration</token> implementation helps bridge these differences by understanding the different protocols and message formats.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Message validation</embeddedLabel>: While the incoming purchase order might be in different message formats for different retailers, the incoming purchase orders should conform to one of those defined message formats.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Message validation</embeddedLabel>: While the incoming purchase order might be in different message formats for different retailers, the incoming purchase orders should conform to one of those defined message formats.

trans-unit.source: This is achieved through message validation.
trans-unit.target: This is achieved through message validation.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Message transformation</embeddedLabel>: The supplier adheres to a common purchase order format.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Message transformation</embeddedLabel>: The supplier adheres to a common purchase order format.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, the incoming purchase orders have to be normalized to this common format.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, the incoming purchase orders have to be normalized to this common format.

trans-unit.source: This is achieved through message transformation.
trans-unit.target: This is achieved through message transformation.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Hybrid connectivity</embeddedLabel>: The supplier's data store is an on-premises Microsoft SQL server.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Hybrid connectivity</embeddedLabel>: The supplier's data store is an on-premises Microsoft SQL server.

trans-unit.source: The normalized purchase order received through the cloud application has to be persisted in the on-premises data store.
trans-unit.target: The normalized purchase order received through the cloud application has to be persisted in the on-premises data store.

trans-unit.source: This is achieved through Hybrid connectivity.
trans-unit.target: This is achieved through Hybrid connectivity.

trans-unit.source: Before You Begin this Tutorial
trans-unit.target: Before You Begin this Tutorial

trans-unit.source: To prepare a <token>af_integration</token> environment, see <link xlink:href="a9584b43-20da-4d5e-8fcf-4253941d4c96" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Administration and Development Task List in BizTalk Services</link>.
trans-unit.target: To prepare a <token>af_integration</token> environment, see <link xlink:href="a9584b43-20da-4d5e-8fcf-4253941d4c96" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Administration and Development Task List in BizTalk Services</link>.

trans-unit.source: To set up the EDI message transfer, you need to access the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: To set up the EDI message transfer, you need to access the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: How to Use this Tutorial
trans-unit.target: How to Use this Tutorial

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is written around a sample, <embeddedLabel>EAIEDITutorial.zip</embeddedLabel>, which is available to download at <externalLink><linkText>MSDN Code Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=316856</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is written around a sample, <embeddedLabel>EAIEDITutorial.zip</embeddedLabel>, which is available to download at <externalLink><linkText>MSDN Code Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=316856</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: You could use the sample and go through this tutorial to understand how the sample was built.
trans-unit.target: You could use the sample and go through this tutorial to understand how the sample was built.

trans-unit.source: Or, you could use this tutorial to create your own application.
trans-unit.target: Or, you could use this tutorial to create your own application.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is targeted towards the second approach so that you understand how this application is built.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is targeted towards the second approach so that you understand how this application is built.

trans-unit.source: Also, as much as possible, the tutorial is consistent with the sample and uses the same names for artifacts (for example, schemas, transforms) as used in the sample.
trans-unit.target: Also, as much as possible, the tutorial is consistent with the sample and uses the same names for artifacts (for example, schemas, transforms) as used in the sample.
